questionTitle: Grace: I wish your parents invite us for holiday. Monty: They can't. They have ________ to accommodate us and the children too.
When they had ________ the new carpet, the workmen went back to the office.
It will ________ be Christmas.
Do be careful not to ________ your coffee on this white rug, Bill.
She had to leave her family ________ when she went abroad to work.
Metal ________ at high temperatures.
Because of the poor harvest, wheat prices have ________ in the last six months.
I'm ________ worried about Jane; she always seems to be tired.
I have difficulty ________ without glasses these days.
Our guest of honour arrived rather late. The party was already ________.
My brother plays his records ________ in his room at night, and nobody can get enough sleep.
It's most unwise to ________ in a quarrel between a man and his wife.
I will ________ the idea with the other teachers and see what they think about it.
The farmer was very angry ________ the dogs chasing his sheep.
I think he's quite honest ________ his intentions.
Dick will be waiting ________ them at the entrance door.
It's no use complaining ________ the cold.
Furniture manufacturers are now ________ of the latest credit restrictions.
Jazz is an American art form which is now ________ in Europe through the determined efforts of ________ in France, Scandinavia, and Germany.
She was ________ disappointed when she learned that she had not got the job.
